titleStmt.title: John T. Parker et al. to James F. Robinson
CWG8868

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p: To His Excellency Gov of Kentucky

Your petitioners would respectfully state that at the present term of the Lewis Circuit Court a judgement was rendered again favor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky against Anthony Evans for $30 and twenty days imprisonment in the County jail
We would respectfully request your Excellency to remit the imprisonment in the county jail -- Evans is a very poor man and fined for an assault & battery committed in a drunken frolick --

Jno. T. Parker Clk. L. Ct. Ct.
A, V, Wilson Clk L Cty Ct
J W Mitchel D Sheriff

Lewis Cir. Ct.
Anthony Evans
Petition
$30 & 20. days imprisonment --
The imprisonment is remitted
J F Robinson
Issd June 10. 1863
